member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.TilemapToolSettings
member.summary: Base class for user-specified settings.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.AutoTilePaintMode
member.summary: Defines whether and how a paint operation will use AutoTile logic that is defined in the used .

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.AutoTilePaintMode.None
member.summary: Potentially defined AutoTiles will be ignored entirely. All painted tiles are exactly like provided by the source.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.AutoTilePaintMode.DirectOnly
member.summary: Only the painted tiles themselves will use AutoTile logic, but no neighbour tiles will be updated in the painting process.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.AutoTilePaintMode.Full
member.summary: Both the painted tiles themselves, as well as neighbouring tiles will be updated according to AutoTile logic.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.PickTilemapTool
member.summary: Allows to select the source pattern for drawing tiles from an existing .

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.SelectTilemapTool
member.summary: Selects the topmost tilemap that is hovered by the mouse cursor for editing.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.FillTilemapTool
member.summary: Flood-fills the selected tile patch with the source pattern.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.FillTilemapTool.GetFloodFillArea(Duality.Plugins.Tilemaps.Tilemap,Duality.Point2,System.Boolean,Duality.Grid{System.Boolean},Duality.Point2@)
member.summary: Runs the flood fill algorithm on the specified position and writes the result into the specified variables.
member.param: If true, the algorithm will cancel when taking too long for an interactive preview.
member.returns: True, if the algorithm completed. False, if it was canceled.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.FillTilemapTool.FloodFillTiles(Duality.Grid{System.Boolean}@,Duality.Grid{Duality.Plugins.Tilemaps.Tile},Duality.Point2,System.Int32,Duality.Point2@,Duality.Point2@)
member.summary: Performs a flood fill operation originating from the specified position. equality is checked in the method.
member.param: A buffer that will be filled with the result of the flood fill operation.
The maximum number of tiles to fill. If the filled tile count exceeds this number, the algorithm is canceled.
member.returns: True when successful. False when aborted.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.OvalTilemapTool
member.summary: Fills all tiles in the selected oval area with the source pattern.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.RectTilemapTool
member.summary: Fills all tiles in the selected rectangular area with the source pattern.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.BrushTilemapTool
member.summary: Draws the source pattern directly onto the tilemap.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.NoTilemapTool
member.summary: A dummy tool that represents not performing any operation on the edited .

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.ITilemapToolEnvironment
member.summary: Provides an interface for instances to access internals and perform editing operations.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.ITilemapToolEnvironment.TileDrawSource
member.summary: [GET / SET] When drawing tiles, this is the source from which the drawn pattern is retrieved. This property is never null. Assigning null will reset it to its default non-null value.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The currently selected .

member.summary: [GET] The coordinate of the that is currently hovered by the mouse cursor.

member.summary: [GET] The currently active .

member.summary: [GET / SET] The coordinates of the actions proposed editing area.

member.summary: [GET] A grid mask that represents the actions proposed editing area.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.ITilemapToolEnvironment.ActiveAreaOutlines
member.summary: [GET] A list of outlines that enclose the actions proposed editing area. Will be determined automatically when cleared.

member.summary: [GET] The coordinate of the where the current action was started.

member.summary: Submits a set of previous changes to or to be used in the editor.
member.param: Specifies whether the currently set editing area represents the actual area the action will be performed in. False is for incomplete or invalid previews.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.TilemapTool.PickPreferSelectedLayer
member.summary: [GET] If true, this tool always prefers the currently selected for editing and picking operations, rather than the one the is nearest to the camera.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.TilemapTool.FadeInPreviews
member.summary: [GET] If true, previews of this operation will be partially faded in to avoid visual noise.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.CamViewStates.TilemapTool.SortOrder
member.summary: [GET] A relative indicator where to put this tool when displaying it to the user. Negative values offset towards the beginning, positive values offset towards the end.

member.summary: A user dialog that allows to quickly generate a set of layers based on some settings.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilemapSetupDialog.Settings.MapSize
member.summary: The width and height of each layer.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilemapSetupDialog.Settings.LayerCount
member.summary: The number of layers that will be generated.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilemapSetupDialog.Settings.Tileset
member.summary: The that will be used for the generated layers. If you want each layer to use a different , you can assign them manually after generating the objects.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilemapSetupDialog.Settings.DeepTilemap
member.summary:
Whether or not the generated will produce depth values.
Top-down and side-scrolling maps are usually flat and every tile shares the same depth value. However, if you're setting up a tilemap that uses fake perspective, e.g. a character can walk both in front of and behind a tree, you need a deep , where every tile has its own depth values.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilemapSetupDialog.Settings.GenerateCollisionShapes
member.summary: Whether or not the generated layers will be used as a source for generating collision shapes in a static .

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.Properties.TilemapsRes.TilesetEditorMode_AutoTile_ViewDesc
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Select or create a new AutoTile layer on the left side of the Tileset Editor. After doing so, you will be able to specify each tile's role when connecting an AutoTile to its surroundings.
The first tile you click on will determine the fully connected base tile (orange). With left and right click, you can then add or remove the connecting parts of the remaining tiles.
Hold the shift key to specify external tiles that are not part of the AutoTile itself, but will be connected to..

member.summary: Describes an editing mode of the . This is a base class that can be derived from in order to implement a new editing mode.

member.summary: [GET] The that is currently selected in the editor.

member.summary: [GET] The that hosts this .

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilesetEditorModes.TilesetEditorMode.TilesetView
member.summary: [GET] The of the , which can be customized on a per- basis.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilesetEditorModes.TilesetEditorMode.Id
member.summary: [GET] The editing mode's unique and persistent id. As far as possible, this should be a constant across versions.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilesetEditorModes.TilesetEditorMode.Name
member.summary: [GET] The editing mode's name that is displayed to the user.

member.summary: [GET] An icon that is used to visually identify this editing mode.

member.summary: [GET] An that describes the contents of the layer view.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilesetEditorModes.TilesetEditorMode.Description
member.summary: [GET] A user-targeted description of the purpose of this editing mode.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilesetEditorModes.TilesetEditorMode.SortOrder
member.summary: [GET] When displaying various editing modes in a list, this defines the sorting order in which they are listed. Lower values are listed first, higher values last. The default is zero.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilesetEditorModes.TilesetEditorMode.AllowLayerEditing
member.summary: [GET] Whether this allows users to edit its layers.

member.summary: [GET] Whether this allows displaying tile indices on top of the tiles, should the user request it.

member.summary: Removes the currently selected layer from the that is defined by this .

member.summary: [GET] The original tileset layout's number of tiles in X and Y direction.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilemapsEditorPlugin.TileDrawingSource
member.summary: [GET / SET] The data source that is used for retrieving tile patterns while using a tile drawing tool. Can be thought of as the "tile brush" that is currently used in user editing operations.

member.summary: Informs the system that a is required and creates one, if none is present yet.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.Plugins.Tilemaps.TilemapsEditorPlugin.PopTilePalette
member.summary: Informs the system that a is no longer required and closes it, if no other claims are pending.
